title: Grade 5
subject: College and Career Ready Standards for Literacy (CCRSL) (2017-)

document.title: DoDEA College and Career Ready Standards for English Language Arts & Literacy in History/Social Studies, Science, and Technical Subjects

006AA6020CE04780B32DBADBA89CB168.description:
Acquire and use accurately grade-appropriate general academic
and domain-specific words and phrases, including those that
signal contrast, addition, and other logical relationships (e.g.,
however, although, nevertheless, similarly, moreover, in
addition).

F31C449B325448C8961D62A21C2DC806.description:
Use the relationship between particular words (e.g.,
synonyms, antonyms, homographs) to better understand
each of the words.

C00E1E39C7E94B63BE7A0DE67C98ECE8.description:
Recognize and explain the meaning of common idioms,
adages, and proverbs.

8EE8ADA5C70B489EBCD9FE25E9DC7C41.description:
Interpret figurative language, including similes and
metaphors, in context.

79E79BD466244B56BB0C5912F8BE1968.description:
Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word
relationships, and nuancesin word meanings.

60D2D7AA340045189BBDC42AC211D4C4.description:
Consult reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries,
thesauruses), both print and digital, to find the
pronunciation and determine or clarify the precise meaning
of key words and phrases.

1C3CF24C466B483B9B4308982877E200.description:
Use common, grade-appropriate Greek and Latin affixes
and roots as clues to the meaning of a word (e.g.,
photograph,photosynthesis).

57D49147BE3341C89EA5338F71E9B95C.description:
Use context (e.g., cause/effect relationships and
comparisonsin text) as a clue to the meaning of a word or
phrase.

49110F5F1E6D435C8768D4079C67B3D3.description:
Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiplemeaning words and phrases based on grade 5 reading and
content, choosing flexibly from a range ofstrategies.

0855076930C24650B8EAFD996FCED8F7.description:
Compare and contrast the varieties of English (e.g., dialects,
registers) used in stories, dramas, or poems.

B13A0CF0EF154A48889314E2F525B407.description:
Expand, combine, and reduce sentencesfor meaning,
reader/listenerinterest, and style.

D67C219A9A9F433E9A5C9CC7F79A739E.description:
Use knowledge of language and its conventions when writing,
speaking, reading, or listening.

8D3AADF219BB425F9009FCAF168F9BC3.description:
Spell grade-appropriate words correctly, consulting
references as needed.

14CCFE76B29D4077A6E130098C250FC6.description:
Use underlining, quotation marks, or italicsto indicate titles
of works

0B2DAD5470C942DE945156FFA6CDA5FE.description:
Use a comma to set off the words yes and no (e.g., Yes,
thank you), to set off a tag question from the rest of the
sentence (e.g., It's true, isn’t it?), and to indicate direct
address (e.g., Is that you, Steve?).

2E8794A982FA4CFA97E0B284FFBC2367.description:
Use a comma to separate an introductory element from the
rest of the sentence

BC577A1033FF47349144216C13194358.description: Use punctuation to separate items in a series.

1CDC706A910A4BC0A82DC11E18D9AF3B.description:
Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English
capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

FAC4A4B8994E4012B8EA0641DADFE393.description: Recognize and correct inappropriate shiftsin verb tense

FDD62FC55B194752AB50AB41DA36367C.description:
Use verb tense to convey varioustimes, sequences, states,
and conditions.

7C08BDCB22ED4D26BAF785CF11E5B22E.description:
Form and use the perfect (e.g., I had walked; I have walked;
I will have walked) verb tenses.

68EE49AECB844D6EA042F57B2AF866AF.description:
Explain the function of conjunctions, prepositions, and
interjections in general and their function in particular
sentences.

5EDFED5F529C473BB3576D63E4F2AB9D.description:
Demonstrate command of the conventions ofstandard English
grammar and usage when writing orspeaking.

ABA62EEA5FF9407598F617B8F163C70D.description:
Adaptspeech to a variety of contexts and tasks, using formal
English when appropriate to task and situation. (See grade 5
Language standards 1 and 3 forspecific expectations.)

C0F954988184425A9FE777D939010A98.description:
Include multimedia components (e.g., graphics, sound) and
visual displays in presentations when appropriate to enhance the
development of main ideas or themes.

E72D139C6BF84E4E805AAD00FD3BB0D4.description:
Report on a topic or text or present an opinion, sequencing ideas
logically and using appropriate facts and relevant, descriptive
detailsto support main ideas or themes;speak clearly at an
understandable pace.

C09A8E0064114FFCB274C885637AE665.description:
Summarize the points a speaker makes and explain how each
claim issupported by reasons and evidence.

C05AA9C1A78647C4AF850BF7BEB2C027.description:
Summarize a written text read aloud or information presented in
diverse media and formats, including visually, quantitatively, and
orally

CF8D9068F0E04F00842285BF98F38C2B.description:
Review the key ideas expressed and draw conclusions in
light of information and knowledge gained from the
discussions.

CD6B7C131A6F48D08F3293C49E35B7A8.description:
Pose and respond to specific questions by making
commentsthat contribute to the discussion and elaborate
on the remarks of others

072DBBE52B754092B78D77E241F99CC9.description:
Follow agreed-upon rules for discussions and carry out
assigned roles.

09304992C55048888C69216729CEDF44.description:
Come to discussions prepared, having read orstudied
required material; explicitly draw on that preparation and
other information known about the topic to explore ideas
under discussion.

A2FA6253452040D29254F25BD02E9658.description:
Engage effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (oneon-one, in groups, and teacher-led) with diverse partners on
grade 5 topics and texts, building on others’ ideas and expressing
their own clearly.

ABB6B43DABA54BAFBF5FEA9D63E0DF51.description:
Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research,
reflection, and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting
or a day or two) for a range of discipline-specific tasks, purposes,
and audiences.

213E3B6B1CC549829FAA70B303008B4D.description:
Apply grade 5 Reading standards to informational texts
(e.g., "Explain how an author usesreasons and evidence to
support particular points in a text, identifying which
reasons and evidence supports which point[s].").

8153FC7B572546DDA687708D96877269.description:
Apply grade 5 Reading standards to literature (e.g.,
"Compare and contrast two or more characters, settings, or
events in a story or a drama, drawing on specific detailsin
the text [e.g., how charactersinteract].").

E65356C378ED486998391201F23E4C81.description:
Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support
analysis, reflection, and research.

4DD295E8C53642A1997B93B72BB173B1.description:
Recall relevant information from experiences or gather relevant
information from print and digitalsources;summarize or
paraphrase information in notes and finished work, and provide
a list of sources

BB112F720E85467FA9CEEE0565D4A805.description:
Conduct short research projects that use severalsourcesto build
knowledge through investigation of different aspects of a topic.

9E28953C6CDF4963A261FA8D12A58E14.description:
With some guidance and support from adults, use technology,
including the Internet, to produce and publish writing as well as
to interact and collaborate with others; demonstrate sufficient
command of keyboarding skills to type a minimum of two pages
in a single sitting.

5A4D4DF265C14960A4C73BAC33DC6C07.description:
With guidance and support from peers and adults, develop and
strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing,
rewriting, or trying a new approach. (Editing for conventions
should demonstrate command of Language standards 1–3 up to
and including grade 5.)

71DC23C91DD9421386DB769278EACB26.description:
Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development
and organization are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.

C76E52CE5B724F0695A7B080F34F422E.description:
Provide a conclusion that followsfrom the narrated
experiences or events

918C5F0FCA59444BBFA6DE55FA8BF94B.description:
Use concrete words and phrases and sensory detailsto
convey experiences and events precisely.

8B37F807E67C40029E46B6C511FC4FC2.description:
Use a variety of transitional words, phrases, and clauses to
manage the sequence of events.

195BDF50935F4EF989EB710E13B5155E.description:
Use narrative techniques, such as dialogue, description, and
pacing, to develop experiences and events orshow the
responses of charactersto situations.

5CBAD5DFA79145079F4ACD8F21C082FF.description:
Orient the reader by establishing a situation and
introducing a narrator and/or characters; organize an event
sequence that unfolds naturally.

E720E959FD0B4FEFBBF65674DE4A3F5E.description:
Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or
events using effective technique, descriptive details, and clear
event sequences

CD33823E51D746E8980FDCBEBF8B12AA.description:
Provide a concluding statement orsection related to the
information or explanation presented.

A528C083650F4364B05AFEFA82755896.description:
Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to
inform about or explain the topic

8C231F50811A46339FA92DB0315C7AFB.description:
Link ideas within and across categories of information using
words, phrases, and clauses (e.g., in contrast, especially).

5ECC1E5AF9A64F45904C43DC36D75C92.description:
Develop the topic with facts, definitions, concrete details,
quotations, or other information and examples related to
the topic.

59B8EACD70D846C6B99DBC48D93871C4.description:
Introduce a topic clearly, provide a general observation and
focus, and group related information logically; include
formatting (e.g., headings), illustrations, and multimedia
when useful to aiding comprehension.

43341C0B2D1F458BA36F85D9A0D72353.description:
Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and
convey ideas and information clearly.

8427B2D56DDE42A8906D42D1C2026A14.description:
Provide a concluding statement orsection related to the
opinion presented.

D23FEC7B51AB4C819C01249289F04907.description:
Link opinion and reasons using words, phrases, and clauses
(e.g., consequently,specifically).

BA8728C85484439C879E15F3DFBCE24E.description:
Provide logically ordered reasonsthat are supported by
facts and details.

8FFFADADE2664247AA6489DFFF93342F.description:
Introduce a topic or text clearly, state an opinion, and
create an organizationalstructure in which ideas are
logically grouped to support the writer’s purpose

40D87CB2E089474886B820D758CE4668.description:
Write opinion pieces on topics or texts, supporting a point of
view with reasons and information.

D8D3C72CFA184E549D0F1655A6180CC0.description: Create readable documents with legible handwriting (cursive).

39D7AF4914D6482F9BE23E2244933CF5.description:
Use context to confirm orself-correct word recognition and
understanding, rereading as necessary.

01B3E51251E84D25B0B06F52977F1563.description:
Read on-level prose and poetry orally with accuracy,
appropriate rate, and expression on successive readings.

D427F03177A84F7CA835AB7C37D1F9B9.description: Read on-level text with purpose and understanding.

869A6361FB1F4BF489E0EE7445D56DFA.description:
Read with sufficient accuracy and fluency to support
comprehension.

6C1F9ABB6D654A02A91857FBBFDA0816.description:
Use combined knowledge of all letter-sound
correspondences, syllabication patterns, and morphology
(e.g. roots and affixes) to read accurately unfamiliar
multisyllabic words in context and out of context.

600B3AA6F4304A949C643C237BFD75A2.description:
Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysisskills in
decoding words.

B756AAA3A9F94C7F82C8BC95913D2C16.description:
By the end of the year, read and comprehend informational
texts, including history/social studies, science, and technical
texts, at the high end of the grades 4–5 text complexity band
independently and proficiently.

60EE57F6A5FD4B969384E0F8C856550E.description:
Integrate information from several texts on the same topic in
order to write or speak about the subject knowledgeably.

73024348DA044F859A775DB1CB54DF2E.description:
Explain how an author uses reasons and evidence to support
particular points in a text, identifying which reasons and
evidence support which point(s).

84FDBABAEF9A417B99B9DAB3F19E044B.description:
Draw on information from multiple print or digital sources,
demonstrating the ability to locate an answer to a question
quickly or to solve a problem efficiently.

C1418EECA64048C284ED0140EE8838E6.description:
Analyze multiple accounts of the same event or topic, noting
importantsimilarities and differences in the point of view they
represent.

324A0B15CF7F4401B89FA952A820DCCE.description:
Compare and contrast the overallstructure (e.g., chronology,
comparison, cause/effect, problem/solution) of events, ideas,
concepts, or information in two or more texts

84898DFB441D44B1B9FF57C4ECBA3183.description:
Determine the meaning of general academic and domainspecific words and phrases in a text relevant to a grade 5 topic or
subject area

DB4890AC60C244698BD9B6CCA517FDA1.description:
Explain the relationships or interactions between two or more
individuals, events, ideas, or concepts in a historical, scientific, or
technical text based on specific information in the text.

56ABB29E41A84FF89EE3D1FFD297D13F.description:
Determine two or more main ideas of a text and explain how
they are supported by key details;summarize the text.

002D321205114AB29A5AEA9F8B9CB83D.description:
Quote accurately from a text when explaining what the text says
explicitly and when drawing inferencesfrom the text.

382544B45BAF433990102C8AA913AC54.description:
By the end of the year, read and comprehend literature,
including stories, dramas, and poetry, at the high end of grades
4–5 text complexity band independently and proficiently.

28B6A5B7C95849778E9061E2BE5F1847.description:
Compare and contrast stories in the same genre (e.g., mysteries
and adventure stories) on their approaches to similar themes
and topics.

F1F9E527E29846A0AD0D5F07BBCE9D4E.description:
Analyze how visual and multimedia elements contribute to the
meaning, tone, or beauty of a text (e.g., graphic novel,
multimedia presentation of fiction, folktale, myth, poem)

66422648429B4EE598520E9E34F691CF.description:
Describe how a narrator’s or speaker’s point of view influences
how events are described.

5FE5EA68F1094100A50BF782E0BB471B.description:
Explain how a series of chapters, scenes, or stanzas fits together
to provide the overall structure of a particular story, drama, or
poem.

263428DB56FF4173B9249C026745FCBD.description:
Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in
a text, including figurative language such as metaphors and
similes.

CCB208D0E83B47C39225F53C4D117435.description:
Compare and contrast two or more characters, settings, or
events in a story or drama, drawing on specific details in the text
(e.g., how characters interact).

ABE795FCA464476E8921B460E63DCA2C.description:
Determine a theme of a story, drama, or poem from detailsin
the text, including how characters in a story or drama respond to
challenges or how the speaker in a poem reflects upon a topic;
summarize the text.

52D598991A134030B1D37F3192DF357F.description:
Quote accurately from a text when explaining what the text says
explicitly and when drawing inferences from the text.
